header.subject: ENGINE FUEL AND CONTROL - Engine Fuel Pump Replacement

summary.background: In April 2020, Boeing identified a potential issue with the fuel pumps on the 737-8 and 737-9 airplanes, which could lead to fuel supply problems. Boeing decided to issue a service bulletin to replace the affected fuel pumps to ensure safe and reliable operations.
summary.description: This service bulletin provides instructions for replacing the engine fuel pumps on the affected airplanes.

planning_information.reason: To address the identified potential issue with the fuel pumps on the 737-8 and 737-9 airplanes, which could lead to fuel supply problems.

description.step: 2. Install the new fuel pump assembly.
3. Perform a functional test of the fuel pump.

planning_information.compliance: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has issued an Airworthiness Directive related to this service bulletin, making the compliance tasks and times given in this service bulletin mandatory.
planning_information.approval: This service bulletin was examined by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). The actions specified in this service bulletin comply with the applicable regulations and are FAA approved, as well as European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA)/Joint Aviation Authorities (JAA) approved for all EASA/JAA approved airplanes listed in the service bulletin effectivity.

step.text: RC - Remove the existing fuel pump assembly from the engine as per AMM 28-21-00.
RC - Install the new fuel pump assembly and secure it as per AMM 28-21-00.
RC - Perform a functional test of the new fuel pump assembly to ensure proper operation.

section.title: 1. Fuel Pump Replacement Instructions
section.content: Ensure all safety procedures are followed while performing the fuel pump replacement. Use the standard maintenance tools specified in the tooling required section. Verify the new fuel pump assembly is properly secured and perform a functional test after installation.
